newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Trygg-Hansa aims to double volume by 2000.
newsitem.headline: Trygg-Hansa aims to double volume by 2000.

text.p: Swedish insurance company Trygg-Hansa AB said on Tuesday its goal was to double its volume by the year 2000 and cut costs.
Speaking to reporters at a breakfast meeting in Stockholm, Trygg-Hansa's managing director Lars Thunell said: "If it's not possible to double the volume we must cut costs further."
Although the finance market faces a period of major restructuring, Thunell said the emphasis must be on the firm's ability to compete so the volume could increase.
"The focus must lie in the company's ability to compete. Profitability is a relationship between how good a company is relative to the competition," Thunell said.
Personnel costs must be reduced and staff must be more flexible, Thunell said.

"The insurance market has extremely high staff costs. There is too large a difference between a good and a bad salesperson, which means the fixed salary is too high. We must do something about this," Thunell said.
